title: 108_hr5226
content: CROP DISASTER ASSISTANCE. In this section, definitions are provided for terms related to crop insurance, including additional coverage, insurable commodity, and noninsurable commodity. The Federal Crop Insurance Act defines terms related to crop insurance, including noninsurable commodity as an agricultural product eligible for assistance. The Secretary of Agriculture can provide emergency financial assistance to producers using funds from the Commodity Credit Corporation. The Federal Crop Insurance Act allows the Secretary of Agriculture to use funds from the Commodity Credit Corporation to provide emergency financial assistance to producers who have incurred crop losses due to damaging weather conditions in 2003 or 2004. The assistance is administered in a similar manner as provided under section 815 of the Agriculture, Rural Development, Food and Drug Administration. The Secretary can provide assistance for crop losses due to damaging weather conditions, following similar procedures as outlined in the Agriculture, Rural Development, Food and Drug Administration Act. Producers may not be eligible for assistance for losses on an insurable commodity. Producers on a farm may be ineligible for assistance under this section if they did not obtain insurance for insurable commodities or file paperwork for noninsurable commodities. Producers on a farm may be ineligible for assistance if they did not obtain insurance for insurable commodities or file paperwork for noninsurable commodities. The Secretary may waive requirements if producers enter into a contract agreeing to certain conditions. The Secretary may waive requirements for producers on a farm if they enter into a contract agreeing to obtain insurance for insurable commodities and file paperwork for noninsurable commodities. The producer must obtain insurance for insurable commodities and file paperwork for noninsurable commodities for the next 2 crops. Violation of the contract requires reimbursement to the Secretary for assistance received. Payment limitations apply. In case of contract violation, the producer must reimburse the Secretary for assistance received. Payment limitations apply, with assistance not exceeding 95% of the crop's estimated value in the absence of losses. The producer must reimburse the Secretary for assistance received in case of contract violation. Payment limitations apply, with assistance not exceeding 95% of the crop's estimated value in the absence of losses. The Secretary includes crop insurance payments and the value of the crop that was not lost in applying the limitation. The producer's assistance under the Federal Agricultural Improvement and Reform Act of 1996 is subject to payment limitations. The value of the crop not lost and any assistance received under Florida Disaster Programs will reduce the amount of assistance received. The Livestock Assistance Program is outlined in Section 2. Emergency Financial Assistance will be provided by the Secretary of Agriculture using funds from the Commodity Credit Corporation for livestock losses in counties with emergency designations after January 1, 2003. Producers can choose to receive assistance for 2003 or 2004 losses, with a portion allocated for the American Indian livestock program. The Secretary of Agriculture will provide emergency financial assistance for livestock losses in designated counties after January 1, 2003. Funds will be allocated for the American Indian livestock program, following the same administration as specified in the Agriculture, Rural Development, Food and Drug Administration, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2001. Eligibility for payments will be determined based on mitigation factors. In the Agriculture, Rural Development, Food and Drug Administration, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2001, the Secretary shall not penalize producers who take actions to reduce livestock numbers during disaster conditions for eligibility in the livestock assistance program. The Tree Assistance Program is outlined in Section 3. The Secretary of Agriculture will use funds from the Commodity Credit Corporation to provide emergency assistance to producers who suffered tree losses between December 1, 2003, and December 31, 2004. An additional $15,000,000 will be used to reimburse eligible orchardists under the tree assistance program. The Secretary of Agriculture will use $15,000,000 from the Commodity Credit Corporation to provide reimbursement to eligible forest land owners who have suffered tree losses during a specified period. The Secretary of Agriculture will allocate an additional $50,000,000 from the Commodity Credit Corporation for the Emergency Conservation Program, providing assistance to participants with the maximum cost share percentage. The Commodity Credit Corporation will be utilized to implement this Act, and regulations will be established accordingly. The Secretary of Agriculture may issue regulations to implement the Act without following certain procedural requirements. The Secretary of Agriculture can issue regulations to implement the Act without following specific procedural requirements, effective July 24, 1971. Congressional review of agency rulemaking will be conducted using the authority provided under section 808 of title 5, United States Code. SEC. 7. OFFSET. Amends Section 1241(a)(3) of the Food Security Act of 1985 to allocate $6,037,000,000 for fiscal years 2005 through 2014.
